metadata.name: Dorothy Jones

persona.name: Robert King
persona.role: Existing customer, franchise gym owner (2 locations)
persona.goal: Renew/renegotiate service terms and schedule a callback with sales
persona.context: Current contract nearing renewal; wants to avoid price increases; can approve purchase but wants options laid out

intent.name: Vague Request About Internet Without Business Context
intent.description: The customer asks about internet but doesn’t specify business vs residential or whether they’re an existing customer.
intent.goal: Clarify customer type and route to sales appointment or appropriate support/portal.
intent.initialMessage: How much is internet and what do I need to sign up?

emotion.name: Skeptical
emotion.description: Challenges claims, asks for proof or confirmation, references past bad experiences, and questions pricing or reliability.

metadata.outcome: Callback scheduled with sales for renewal/pricing discussion.

turns.content: How much is internet and what do I need to sign up?

Our Business Class agent can give you exact pricing and sign‑up details.  
Can I schedule a call for you?  
May I have your name and confirm this is for a business?

messages:
Our Business Class agent can give you exact pricing and sign‑up details.  
Can I schedule a call for you?  
May I have your name and confirm this is for a business?

turns.content:
Yeah, it’s for a business. I run two franchise gyms.  

Name’s Robert King. Before we set anything, is this for new service only, or can you actually look at renewal/pricing options for an existing account too?
I can have our Business Class agent review both new and renewal options for you, Robert. Can we set up a call? What date, time, and timezone work best?

messages: I can have our Business Class agent review both new and renewal options for you, Robert. Can we set up a call? What date, time, and timezone work best?

turns.content:
Alright, that works.  

Let’s do a call **next Monday morning around 10:00 AM Eastern**. And just so I know what to expect, will they have my current plan and pricing in front of them, or do I need to dig up my last bill before the call?

Great, I’ve set the call for Monday, January 19, 2026, 10:00 AM ET. Our agent can pull your current plan if you share your last bill, otherwise they’ll look it up. Please reply with the phone number to send the reminder text.

messages: Great, I’ve set the call for Monday, January 19, 2026, 10:00 AM ET. Our agent can pull your current plan if you share your last bill, otherwise they’ll look it up. Please reply with the phone number to send the reminder text.

turns.content:
Alright, send it to **469-966-7058**.  

I’ll have my last bill handy so they can’t “mystery fee” me again—will the agent be able to talk both locations’ accounts in that same call, or is it one account per appointment?
